bugs.title: CVE-2014-0132 389-ds-base: 389-ds: flaw in parsing authzid can lead to privilege escalation [epel-5]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2014-0132 389-ds-base: 389-ds: flaw in parsing authzid can lead to privilege escalation [epel-5]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2014-0132 389-ds: flaw in parsing authzid can lead to privilege escalation

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was reported [1] in how the 389 Directory Server handled SASL-based authentication, in particular when the authzid parameter is specified.  A flaw in the SASL mechanism handling allowed a user who could legitimately authenticate to the Directory Server, to use the directory as any other user they wished.  This could allow an unprivileged directory user to effectively elevate privileges to the Directory Manager.  This could allow a user to modify configuration values, as well as read and write any data the directory holds.

A patch to correct this flaw is available in git [2].

[1] https://fedorahosted.org/389/ticket/47739
[2] https://fedorahosted.org/389/changeset/76acff12a86110d4165f94e2cba13ef5c7ebc38a/

Created 389-ds-base tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1076117]
Affects: epel-5 [bug 1076118]

This issue has been addressed in following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6

Via RHSA-2014:0292 https://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2014-0292.html
This has been corrected in EPEL5 via 389-ds-base-1.2.11.28-1.el5, in Fedora 20 via 389-ds-base-1.3.2.16-1.fc20 and in Fedora 19 via 389-ds-base-1.3.1.22-1.fc19.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of Fedora EPEL.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When creating a Bodhi update request, please use the bodhi submission link
noted in the next comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this
tracking bug as well as the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
Bodhi notes field when available.

epel-5 tracking bug for 389-ds-base: see blocks bug list for full details of the security issue(s).

Please use the following update submission link to create the Bodhi

as this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get
updated when new packages are pushed to stable.

Please also ensure that the "Close bugs when update is stable" option
remains checked.

https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/new/?type_=security&bugs=1074845,1076118

https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/389-ds-base-1.2.11.26-1.el5

https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/389-ds-base-1.2.11.28-1.el5

Package 389-ds-base-1.2.11.28-1.el5:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=epel-testing 389-ds-base-1.2.11.28-1.el5'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2014-0834/389-ds-base-1.2.11.28-1.el5
then log in and leave karma (feedback).
389-ds-base-1.2.11.28-1.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
